text: <extra_id_0> Eotaxin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an eosinophil specific beta-chemokine assumed to be involved in eosinophilic inflammatory diseases such as atopic dermatitis , allergic rhinitis , asthma and parasitic infections .
Its expression is stimulus - and cell - specific .

We here describe the genomic organisation ( 3 exons of 132 , 112 and 542 bp and 2 introns of 1211 and 378 bp ) and sequence including 3 kb of DNA from the immediate 5 ' upstream region of the human <extra_id_0> eotaxin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

Among the regulatory promoter elements potentially regulating <extra_id_0> eotaxin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression and / or mediating the effects of anti-inflammatory drugs we identified consensus sequences known to interact with nuclear factors like <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , AP-1 , a NF-kappa-B like consensus sequence and <extra_id_0> gamma-interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - as well as glucocorticoid response elements .
